title.narrative: PROGRAMME COORDINATION

description.narrative: Staff and partners have enhanced capacity to provide timely assistance to programmes in line with office key performance indicators, which contributes to Technical Excellence In Policy And Programmes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Country programmes are efficiently designed, coordinated, managed and supported to meet quality standards in achieving results for childrenÂ

participating-org.narrative: STATE MINISTRY OF HEALTH CENTRAL EQUATORIA GOSS

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Staff and partners have enhanced capacity to provide timely assistance to programmes in line with office key performance indicators

description.narrative: The Partnership Review Secretariat facilitated the development and management of 142 active Programme Cooperation Agreements/Small-Scale Financing Arrangements (PCAs/SSFAs); there were 131 Programme Documents with 74 international and 57 national partners (total value US$132M in cash; US$54M in supplies). 28% of UNICEF funding to partners was to national NGOs. As part of Grand Bargain commitments, a localization strategy was developed to support partnering with the South Sudan NGO Forum on a targeted capacity building programme for national NGOs. Harmonized Approach to Cash Transfers (HACT) implementation exceeded targets with a total of 507 programme visits (165% of the minimum requirement). | Status:On-track | As-of Date:17/01/2020
